channel.title: Sleep Apnea on VitaminDWiki
channel.description: Recent content in Sleep Apnea on VitaminDWiki

item.title: DNA and VDR tests - 100 to 200 dollars
item.description:
• Many DNA gene testing services (most only provide ancestry info.)
    • VDR tests the gene you were born with, not it’s activation
      • Vitamin D Receptor test $119
      • Vitamin D Receptor test $86 + ship to Greece
      • Varous companies can post-analyze DNA tests (such as 23andMe) to discover VDR, etc.
      • VDR test : muscle mass and bone strength (Dec 2016)

Many DNA gene testing services (most only provide ancestry info.)

  • 3 Essential Tips You Must Know Before Buying a DNA Test

item.title: Sleep Apnea patients – 98 percent had low vitamin D
item.description:
• See also web

See also web

  • CPAP increased Vitamin D levels in males April 2014 free PDF is online

  • Adults 45% more likely to have Sleep Apnea if low vitamin D Feb 2016

    • Download the PDF from VitaminDWiki

item.title: Off topic: Earthing to improve health (bare skin grounded to the earth)
item.description:
Earthing experience by a person who has MS AND treats people with MS - June 2019** Personalized Vitamin D3 For MS With Michael Cawley, Facebook: **“Greetings from Sunny Mallorca! Three weeks ago I read Clint Obers book on the medical benefits of free electrons from the Earth via grounding. What grabbed my interest was the amount of people with auto immune diseases reporting a sustained reduction of symptoms from daily grounding. I bought a Clint Ober bed mat and brought it with me to Spain. After about 10 days I noticed my energy and sense of vitality had improved. I love to walk in the hills here but since a relapse 3 years ago my legs prefer not to walk for more than 2 hours. This year on the 2 hour walks my legs felt like normal and I decided to do a walk I thought I would never do again. It is a 5 hour walk with a 400 meter elevation which is intense. I set off at 9 am and enjoyed a peaceful wander in the hills. My legs and energy were perfect and I felt like I had a new body.

I was grounded (verified) by socket tester for** 9 hours a night and two hours a day **with bare feet on soil for 12 days before this walk.

item.title: The Better Sleep Vitamin (Vitamin D) – nice 3 dollar book
item.description:
The Better Sleep Vitamin: How I Fixed My Sleep By Regulating My Levels Of Vitamin D

Kathy Aquino, Amazon, $3,     48 pages

  • Nice Vitamin D book overall, with nice description of sleep and vitamin D

  • Had poor sleep, watched lecture by Dr. Stasha Gorminak (60-80 ng/mL)

  • Healthy diet does not supply enough vitamin D.

  • Supplements, UV light and sunlight are good sources

  • Restless leg syndrome described, along with sleep apnea

  • She incorrectly states that taking Vitamin D with a meal is not important (take with big meal of the day)

item.title: Vitamin D Receptor
item.description:
1. It appears that 1/3 of everyone with a vitamin D-related disease has a poor VDR

  2. A poor VDR cannot be detected by any standard Vitamin D test (nor Calcitriol nor Calcidiol)

  3. A poor Parathyroid VDR can be detected when high Calcitriol levels fail to decrease PTH levels

Decreasing PTH shows Vitamin D is getting to Parathyroid - but says nothing about VDRs elsewhere

  1. Many cancers and viruses have learned to protect themselves by deactivating the local VDR

item.title: Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) reduced somewhat by 50,000 IU vitamin D every 2 weeks – RCT
item.description:
Does vitamin D improve liver enzymes, oxidative stress, and inflammatory biomarkers in adults with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease? A randomized clinical trial.

Endocrine. 2014 Sep;47(1):70-80. doi: 10.1007/s12020-014-0336-5. Epub 2014 Jun 27.

Sharifi N1, Amani R, Hajiani E, Cheraghian B.

1Department of Nutrition, Faculty of Paramedicine, Ahvaz Jundishapur University of Medical Sciences, Ahvaz, Iran, sharifi.nsr@gmail.com.

50,000 IU every two weeks for four months

Vitamin D levels only raised by only 16 ng

item.title: Poor sleep strongly associated with pain in seniors (both associated with low vitamin D)
item.description:
The #1 Predictor for Pain in Adults Over 50 - Do You Make This Mistake? Mercola March 2015

title: Key Strategies for Optimizing Your Sleep

References included

Poor sleep linked to widespread pain Reuters Feb 2014

Which was a report on

Predictors of New-Onset Widespread Pain in Older Adults: Results From a Population-Based Prospective Cohort Study in the UK March 2014

Download the PDF from VitaminDWiki

Observations by Henry Lahore of VitaminDWiki

item.title: Huge increases in health problems – risk factors include Vitamin D, Antibiotics, and Roundup
item.description:
During the past 40 years there have been big increased in

  • Incidence of 34+ diseases - diseases associated with low vitamin D

  • use of Antibiotics

  • Roundup

  • Vitamin D deficiency

There are many studies showing the risk factors for antibiotics, roundup and low vitamin D

The risk factors vary from 1.5X to 15X – depends on the disease

Often it is the same disease: examples - autism, obesity, etc.

Roundup

  • Kills all plants (GMO = Genetically Modified Organism) which have not be designed to resist it (roundup-ready)

item.title: COPD becoming suddenly worse is 30X more likely if low vitamin D
item.description:
Severe vitamin D deficiency is associated with frequent exacerbations and hospitalization in COPD patients

Respiratory Research 2014, 15:131 doi:10.1186/s12931-014-0131-0

Andrei Malinovschi2, Monica Masoero1, Michela Bellocchia1, Antonio Ciuffreda1, Paolo Solidoro3, Alessio Mattei3, Lorena Mercante3, Enrico Heffler1, Giovanni Rolla1 and Caterina Bucca1 caterina.bucca@unito.it

  • 96% of COPD patients had low vitamin D = 33X

  • Those with low Vitamin D were 18X as likely to have COPD

Some of the associated diseases (from PDF)

item.title: Restless Legs Syndrome - Vitamin D, Iron, etc. - many studies
item.description:
RLS has been separately treated by Iron, Magnesium. and Vitamins

      • RLS review by Perplexity AI Jan 2025
      • RLS: genes and glutamate - meta-analysis June 2024
      • Vitamin D and Restless Legs Syndrome: A Review of Current Literature - April 2023
      • RLS associated with low vitamin D, The more severe the RLS, the lower the D - Dec 2021
      • RLS treated by weekly 50,000 IU of vitamin D - Feb 2020
      • RLS 3 X more likely if < 20 ng/mL of Vitamin D (8X if a teacher) – March 2018
      • RLS associated with many other Vitamin D Deficiency diseases - July 2017
      • Restless legs syndrome associated with (a few) major diseases -A systematic review and new concept - April 2016
      • RLS score dropped from 26 to 10 after Vitamin D levels were raised to just 25 ng - Aug 2014
      • Restless Legs Syndrome 5X more likely if vitamin D deficient - May 2014
      • Sleep Apnea solutions may apply also to RLS (Vitamins D and B, good gut)
      • RLS triggers - Oct 2018
      • RLS not treated by weekly 50,000 IU of vitamin D, but was treated by placebo - RCT Nov 2018
      • RLS increased risk of Vascular Dementia 1.8X (suspect low D or Mg) - March 2023

RLS review by Perplexity AI Jan 2025

Restless Legs Syndrome appears to be treated by at least Vitamin D, Vitamin K, Iron and Magnesium.
Are there others? Which is best? Is there some combination which is best?

item.title: Vitamin D intervention – 1204 clinical trials
item.description:
Data is US Clinical Trials

There have been more US intervention trials for vitamin D than for vitamins A, C, E, and K combined

D = 1204, vs 1023 = Total A+C+E+K (A =225 + C =340 + E =328 + K =130)

Other statistics for US Vitamin D Intervention trials

  • 802 trials for those 65+

  • 252 trials for children (age 0-17)

  • 1071 trials updated information since Jan 2010

  • 744 trials registered since Jan 2010

item.title: One pill every two weeks gives you all the vitamin D most adults need
item.description:
50,000 IU of Vitamin D once every two weeks proven to prevent/treat:

Diabetes + Heart Failure + Chronic Pain + Depression + Autism + Breast Cancer + Colon Cancer + Prostate Cancer + BPH (prostate) + Preeclampsia + Premature Birth + Falls + Cognitive Decline + Respiratory Tract Infection + Influenza + Tuberculosis + Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease + Lupus + Inflammatory Bowel Syndrome + Urinary Tract Infection + Poor Sleep + Growing Pain + Multiple Sclerosis + PMS + Schizophrenia + Endometriosis + Smoking     27 problems

item.title: Vitamin D and Neurologic Disorders (overview of vitamin D) - handout Dr. Gominak
item.description:
• Why Vitamin D?
    • Vitamin D is not a vitamin:
    • Why would we make a hormone from sun exposure?
    • D hormone affects our weight and appetite:
    • Low D goofs up sleep.
    • What does D hormone deficiency look like?
    • Poor sleep causes hypertension, heart disease and stroke:
    • Poor sleep causes memory problems and depression:
    • D hormone, bones and calcium:
    • Low D causes balance difficulties and pain:
    • Low D causes infertility, polycystic ovary syndrome and endometriosis:
    • Women bearing babies are the ones who are most affected:
    • Some commonly used medications prevent REM sleep:
    • Vitamin D and aging:
    • What should my vitamin D level be?
    • Why FDA recommendations are so low:
    • What is the right D hormone dose?
    • Practical Aspects:
    • What kind of D and why so many kinds?
    • “I eat a good diet, why would I have other vitamin deficiencies in addition to vitamin D deficiency?”
    • Do our B vitamins really come from our poop?
    • Any other vitamins?

If you have a neurologic problem that is severe enough to see a neurologist, you are probably not healing your body as perfectly as you once did. Most people who are suffering from neurologic problems such as headache, chronic pain, tremor, balance difficulties, dizziness, depression, stroke, or memory loss also have abnormal sleep. Fixing the sleep can often fix the neurologic problem.

item.title: Resistant Hypertension incidence increased 2X in 20 years – vitamin D might help
item.description:
Hypertension which does not respond to 3 types of hypertension reducing drugs is defined as Resistant Hypertension

    • Does a Vitamin D Boost Help in Resistant Hypertension Control?
    • Vitamin D Therapy to Reduce Blood Pressure and Left Ventricular Hypertrophy in Resistant Hypertension RCT March 2014
    • Resistant Hypertension: Incidence, Prevalence and Prognosis Feb 2012, full text online
    • What is the prevalence of resistant hypertension in the United States? July 2012
    • Poor Sleep Increases Risk of Hard-to-Treat Hypertension Mercola, March 2013
    • Google Search for “Resistant Hypertension” AND “Vitamin D” 795,000 hits as of March 2014
    • See also VitaminDWiki

Does a Vitamin D Boost Help in Resistant Hypertension Control?

American Heart Association Editorial – March 2014

item.title: Bipolar Disorder may be related to cellular, not blood Vitamin D
item.description:
Bipolar Disorder = BD = Manic Depression (BD name before 1980)

BD had been just in adults but has increased in children by perhaps 40X since 1980

US appears to have the highest BD rate of any country

BD is partially treated by both Omega-3 and Vitamin D

No data on BD prevention by Vitamin D or Omega-3

      • Does BD develop after taking SSRI for Depression? Feb 2025
      • BD recurrence reduced by 6 months of Omega-3 - small RCT Jan 2024
      • Omega-3 recommended in the treatment of Bipolar Disorder – 2024
      • Vitamin D Status in Bipolar Disorder (no association found) - Nov 2023
      • Bipolar Manic Attacks triggered by lower vitamin D - Sept 2023
      • Vitamin D might help bipolar - Jan 2021
      • Bipolar more likely to start a month after low level of UVB - June 2023
      • Bipolar strongly associated with poor VDR (blood level vit D is a poor indicator) - March 2022
      • More sunlight and higher temperature ==> more bipolar (opposite of Vitamin D association) - Dec 2021
      • Bipolar review of Nutraceuticals (no vitamin D) - Sept 2022
      • BD hypomania reduced by 1 year of Omega-3 - RCT Dec 2020
      • Less sun more Bipolar Disorder - Oct 2014
      • Nutritional and Safety Outcomes from an Open-Label Micronutrient Intervention for Pediatric Bipolar Spectrum Disorders Oct 2013
      • Mood disorders helped by Vitamin D, Omega-3, etc -Jan 2017
      • US has the highest lifetime prevalence of bipolar (note: this will tend to ignore youth)
      • Bipolar treated by bright light (similar to SAD?) - RCT Oct 2017
      • See also web

Does BD develop after taking SSRI for Depression? Feb 2025

In Midwestern Doctor

item.title: More Hypertension in obese children with low vitamin D, especially at night
item.description:
Hypovitaminosis D and nocturnal hypertension in obese children: an interesting link.

J Hum Hypertens. 2013 Dec 5. doi: 10.1038/jhh.2013.122.

Banzato C, Maffeis C, Maines E, Cavarzere P, Gaudino R, Fava C, Minuz P, Boner A, Antoniazzi F.

Department of Life and Reproduction Sciences, Section of Pediatrics, University of Verona, Verona, Italy.

In adults, low levels of vitamin D are associated with hypertension. The aim of this study was to evaluate the relationship between 24-h blood pressure (BP) patterns and vitamin D levels in obese children. We recorded anthropometric parameters, took blood samples for 25-hydroxivitamin D measurements and monitored ambulatory BP (ABP) in 32 obese children (male/female: 21/11, age 7-16 years).

A few of Dr. Gominak’s slides,

all slides are attached at the bottom of this page

Sleep problems cured by vitamin D, etc. – workshops and patient workbooks – Gominak 2018

What’s the right dose?

  • We make 20,000 IU of vitamin D on our skin in 1-6 hours in a bathing suit, middle of the day middle of the summer.

item.title: Sleep disorder and nonspecific pain implies low vitamin D, especially if dark skin
item.description:
Nonspecific pain is a marker for hypovitaminosis D in patients undergoing evaluation for sleep disorders: a pilot study

Published Date March 2013 Volume 2013:5 Pages 37 - 42, DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.2147/NSS.S42641

David E McCarty,1 Aronkumar Reddy,1 Quinton Keigley,2 Paul Y Kim,1 Stephen Cohen,2 Andrew A Marino1

1 Division of Sleep Medicine, Department of Neurology, Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center,

2 School of Medicine, Louisiana State University, Shreveport, LA, USA

Background: The purpose of this cross-sectional study was to test the hypothesis that serum vitamin D levels are abnormally low in sleep clinic patients admitting to chronic nonspecific musculoskeletal pain and to assess the associated risk factors. A secondary purpose was to identify a clinical biomarker for vitamin D deficiency.

item.title: UVA decreased serum levels of vitamin D - RCT
item.description:
Changes in serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D and cholecalciferol after one whole-body exposure in a commercial tanning bed: a randomized study.

Endocrine. 2012 Oct;42(2):430-5. Epub 2012 Mar 6.

Langdahl JH, Schierbeck LL, Bang UC, Jensen JE.

Faculty of Health Science, University of Copenhagen, Copenhagen, Denmark.

We wanted to evaluate the cutaneous synthesis of 25OHD and cholecalciferol after one whole-body exposure to ultraviolet radiation type B (UVB) in a randomized setup. Healthy volunteers were randomized to one whole-body exposure in a commercial tanning bed with UVB emission (UVB/UVA ratio 1.8-2.0%) or an identical placebo tanning bed without UVB. The output in the 280-320 nm range was 450 µW/cm². Blood samples were analyzed for 25OHD and cholecalciferol at baseline and during 7 days after treatment.

item.title: Handout on Vitamin D (Hormone D) and sleep - Gominak 2012
item.description:
(Vitamin) D Hormone

For more information go to www.drgominak.com

Update: Sleep, Vitamin D, Vitamin B-12, IBS, Fibromyalgia - Gominak March 2015

If you have a neurologic problem that is severe enough to see a neurologist, you probably do not heal your body in sleep as perfectly as you once did. Most of us who have headaches, tremor, balance difficulties, vertigo, burning in the feet, depression, body pain, or memory loss have abnormal sleep and, surprisingly, fixing the sleep can fix the neurologic problem. From 2005-2009 I performed sleep studies on most of my patients and used medications or sleep masks to try to help their sleep. In 2009 I accidentally discovered that most of my patients had abnormal sleep because they were vitamin D deficient. Vitamin D deficiency is probably why you are coming to see me today even though you don’t know it. Though we might end up talking about vitamin D I am not really as interested in vitamins as I am in sleep.

item.title: May 2012 Vitamin D News from VitaminDWiki
item.description:
There is a lot of vitamin D news each month.

About 2% of the items found are posted on VitaminDWiki, and just a fraction of those make it to this monthly top news summary

A tiny fraction of all vitamin D news become blog posts.

Reminder: anyone who registers (free) can choose to be immediately informed when there are:

  • new blogs,

  • new items in any of 70+ categories,

  • new overviews (currently there are 53)
